Container.Name: Puck
Container.Overview:
This Dockerfile will download and install SteamCMD and the Puck Dedicated Server (PuckDS).
ATTENTION: First startup can take a few minutes while the container updates, downloads, and installs SteamCMD and the relevant game server files.
INFO: You can run multiple servers with only one SteadCMD directory. Be sure to modify the SERVER_DIR, GAME_PORT, and PING_PORT variable values as those can't be reused.

Config.Name: Server Name
Config.Description: This value is how your server will appear in the server list in game.

Config.Name: Server Password
Config.Description: *Not Required*. You are encouraged to set a password to prevent griefing.

Config.Name: Game Port
Config.Description: If this port is changed from the default, be sure to update the variable 'Game Port - UDP' under the 'Show more settings...' dropdown.

Config.Name: Ping Port
Config.Description: If this port is changed from the default, be sure to update the variable 'Ping Port - UDP' under the 'Show more settings...' dropdown.

Config.Name: Max Players
Config.Description: Default 10 players. Alter this number based on how many players you want on at a time and what your system can handle.

Config.Name: VoIP
Config.Description: Default false. Enables In-game Voice Chat.

Config.Name: Is Public?
Config.Description: Default true. Allows anyone to see and join the server.

Config.Name: Admin IDs
Config.Description:
Comma separated list of all Steam users who should be assigned an Admin role.
(e.g. 76561198237436801,765611982379766802 )

Config.Name: Validate
Config.Description: Set the Variable to 'true' if you want to validate the installation otherwise leave it blank.

Config.Name: Steam Username
Config.Description: Your Steam username goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).

Config.Name: Steam Password
Config.Description: Your Steam password goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).

Config.Name: Game ID
Config.Description: The GAME_ID that the container downloads at startup. (https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dedicated_Servers_List)

Config.Name: Target Frame Rate
Config.Description: Default 120. The actual FPS the server will attempt to run at. Recommended to set this value 10-20 above Tick Rate.

Config.Name: Server Tick Rate
Config.Description: Default 100. This is essentially the

Config.Name: Client Tick Rate
Config.Description: Default 200. The rate at which players clients send input updates to the server (should improve input lag). Experiment with this value for best performance. Recommend starting equal to Server Tick Rate.

Config.Name: Reload Banned Steam IDs
Config.Description: Default false. Re-downloads global ban list on startup.

Config.Name: Use Puck Banned Steam IDs
Config.Description: Default true. Use global ban list.

Config.Name: Print Metrics
Config.Description: Default (true). Print metrics to the console/log.

Config.Name: Kick Timeout
Config.Description: Default 300 seconds. Time before player is kicked for inactivity.

Config.Name: Join Mid Match Delay
Config.Description: Default 10 seconds. Delay in seconds before player can join existing match.

Config.Name: Allow Voting
Config.Description: Default true. Enables player voting for all voting commands.

Config.Name: Start Paused
Config.Description: Default false. Start the match in a paused state.

Config.Name: Sleep Timeout
Config.Description: Default 60 seconds. Seconds before server enters sleep state when no players/matches are active. Server only responds to pings and player joins. Once a player joins, the server enters a WarmUp stage before being fully available.
